definitions: abbreviation for chlorofluorocarbon, a synthetic chemical compound containing carbon, chlorine, and fluorine atoms used in refrigeration and aerosols
examples: The production of CFC was banned to protect the ozone layer
Scientists discovered that CFC emissions were causing atmospheric damage

definitions: compact fluorescent lamp, an energy-efficient light bulb that uses fluorescent technology in a compact design
Canadian Football League, the professional football league in Canada
examples: She replaced all incandescent bulbs with CFL to save electricity
The CFL bulbs last much longer than traditional light bulbs
The CFL championship game attracts millions of viewers across Canada
He played quarterback in the CFL for eight seasons

definitions: chief financial officer, the senior executive responsible for managing a company's financial actions and planning
examples: The CFO presented the quarterly earnings report to investors
Our new CFO has extensive experience in corporate finance

definitions: Central Intelligence Agency, the United States government agency responsible for gathering and analyzing foreign intelligence information
examples: The CIA headquarters is located in Langley, Virginia
Former CIA agents often write memoirs about their experiences

definitions: chief information officer, the senior executive responsible for managing and implementing information technology strategies in an organization
examples: The CIO oversees all technology infrastructure and digital transformation initiatives
Our CIO is leading the company's migration to cloud computing

definitions: Common Business-Oriented Language, an early high-level programming language designed for business data processing applications
examples: Many banks still maintain legacy systems written in COBOL
She learned COBOL to work on mainframe computer systems

definitions: certified public accountant, a licensed accounting professional who has passed examinations and met experience requirements
examples: You should hire a CPA to handle your complex tax situation
She became a CPA after passing all four exam sections

definitions: consumer price index, a measure that examines the average change in prices paid by consumers for goods and services
examples: The CPI rose by 2.5 percent indicating moderate inflation
Economists monitor the CPI to assess cost of living changes

definitions: cardiopulmonary resuscitation, an emergency lifesaving procedure performed when someone's breathing or heartbeat has stopped
examples: The lifeguard immediately began CPR on the drowning victim
Everyone should learn CPR to help in emergency situations

definitions: central processing unit, the primary component of a computer that executes instructions and processes data
examples: The new laptop features a powerful CPU for faster performance
Overclocking the CPU can increase computing speed but generates more heat

definitions: cathode ray tube, a vacuum tube technology used in older television sets and computer monitors to display images
examples: The old CRT monitor was replaced with a flat LCD screen
CRT televisions were bulky but provided excellent picture quality

definitions: Central Standard Time, the time zone used in central regions of North America during standard time periods
examples: The conference call is scheduled for 2 PM CST tomorrow
Chicago operates on CST during the winter months

definitions: a dark-colored grape variety used to make red wine, particularly cabernet sauvignon and cabernet franc wines
examples: The vineyard specializes in growing cabernet grapes for premium wines
This cabernet has rich flavors of blackcurrant and cedar

definitions: a title used by Roman emperors, particularly referring to Julius Caesar and subsequent rulers
a popular salad made with romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan cheese, and caesar dressing
examples: Julius Caesar was assassinated on the Ides of March
The Roman Caesar ruled over a vast empire
She ordered a chicken caesar salad for lunch
The restaurant is famous for its tableside caesar preparation

definitions: a person descended from French-speaking Acadian settlers in Louisiana with distinct cultural traditions
a spicy cooking style originating from Louisiana featuring bold seasonings and ingredients
examples: The Cajun community maintains its unique French dialect and customs
Many Cajun families have lived in Louisiana for generations
The restaurant serves authentic Cajun dishes like jambalaya and gumbo
He seasoned the fish with Cajun spices before grilling

definitions: a yellowish substance produced by honeybees to build honeycomb, used in candles, polishes, and cosmetics
examples: She polished the furniture with natural beeswax for a lustrous finish
The candles were made from pure beeswax harvested from local hives

definitions: a round root vegetable with dark red or purple flesh, commonly used in salads, soups, and as a side dish
examples: The roasted beet salad was topped with goat cheese and walnuts
She grew both red and golden beet varieties in her garden

definitions: an insect with hard wing covers and chewing mouthparts, representing the largest order of insects with over 400,000 species
examples: The shiny green beetle crawled across the garden leaf slowly
Scientists discovered a new beetle species in the rainforest

definitions: a person who lives by asking others for money or food, typically due to poverty or homelessness
examples: The beggar sat outside the subway station asking for spare change
She always gave food to the beggar who slept near her office

definitions: the action of asking for something earnestly or humbly, especially asking for money or help from others
examples: His constant begging for attention became tiresome to everyone
The dog's begging at the dinner table was a bad habit

definitions: a person who is just starting to learn or do something, having little or no experience in a particular activity
examples: The yoga class is designed specifically for beginner students
As a beginner photographer, she practiced taking pictures every day

definitions: a tropical plant with bright, showy flowers and often colorful leaves, commonly grown as a houseplant or garden ornamental
examples: The pink begonia bloomed beautifully on her windowsill all summer
He planted begonia bulbs in hanging baskets for the patio

definitions: a theory in psychology that human and animal behavior can be explained through conditioning without considering thoughts or feelings
examples: Behaviorism dominated psychological research during the early twentieth century
The professor explained how behaviorism differs from cognitive psychology approaches

definitions: the way in which a person or animal acts or conducts themselves, especially toward others
examples: The child's behaviour improved significantly after starting the new routine
Scientists study animal behaviour to understand their natural instincts

definitions: the act of cutting off someone's head, historically used as a form of capital punishment or execution
examples: The museum exhibit described medieval beheading practices in graphic detail
Historical records document the beheading of several notable political prisoners

definitions: something of monstrous size or power, originally referring to a biblical beast but now used for anything enormous
examples: The corporation had become a behemoth dominating the entire industry
The cruise ship was a behemoth carrying thousands of passengers

definitions: a person's orders or command, especially a formal or authoritative request that expects compliance
examples: She attended the meeting at the behest of her supervisor
The investigation was launched at the behest of concerned citizens

definitions: a person who sees or observes someone or something, often used in the phrase beauty is in the eye of the beholder
examples: Beauty truly lies in the eye of the beholder
The beholder of the scene was moved to tears by its majesty

definitions: a pale sandy yellowish-brown color, often used to describe neutral-toned clothing, paint, or decorations
examples: She painted the living room walls in a warm beige tone
His beige suit was perfect for the summer wedding

definitions: a tower or structure that houses bells, typically part of a church or other building
examples: The church belfry contained three ancient bronze bells
Bats had made their home in the old belfry

definitions: the mental act of accepting something as true or real, having faith or confidence in something
examples: Believing in yourself is the first step toward achieving success
She had difficulty believing his elaborate excuse for being late

definitions: a highly toxic plant with purple flowers and black berries, historically used in medicine and cosmetics despite its dangerous properties
examples: The garden tour guide warned visitors not to touch the belladonna
Medieval women used belladonna drops to dilate their pupils for beauty

definitions: a beautiful woman, especially one who is the most attractive at a particular event or in a particular group
examples: She was the belle of the ball in her stunning evening gown
The southern belle graciously welcomed guests to the plantation house

definitions: a plant with bell-shaped flowers, typically blue or purple, belonging to the campanula family
examples: The delicate bellflower bloomed along the garden path each spring
She pressed bellflower blossoms in her botanical collection book

definitions: a person who is hostile and aggressive, eager to fight or argue
a nation or person engaged in war or conflict
examples: The belligerent customer demanded to speak with the manager immediately
His belligerent attitude made peaceful negotiations nearly impossible
The treaty identified all belligerent nations involved in the conflict
Both belligerent parties agreed to a temporary ceasefire

definitions: a hotel employee who carries luggage, delivers messages, and provides various services to guests
examples: The bellman helped carry their heavy suitcases to the room
She tipped the bellman for his excellent service during their stay

definitions: a loud, deep roar or shout, typically expressing pain, anger, or other strong emotion
examples: The wounded bull let out a tremendous bellow of pain
His angry bellow could be heard throughout the entire building

definitions: something that leads or indicates trends, originally a sheep wearing a bell that leads the flock
examples: The company's stock price serves as a bellwether for the tech industry
Iowa is considered a political bellwether in presidential elections

definitions: an item or items that are owned by or associated with someone
the feeling of being accepted and fitting in within a group or place
examples: She packed all her belongings into three cardboard boxes
The lost and found office collected various belongings left behind
The new student struggled to find a sense of belonging at school
Creating belonging in the workplace improves employee satisfaction significantly

definitions: strong fabric or material used to make belts or reinforced bands for machinery
a powerful singing technique producing loud, resonant vocal tones
examples: The factory produced industrial belting for conveyor systems
She bought leather belting to make custom belts
Her belting performance of the national anthem impressed everyone
The vocal coach taught proper belting technique to protect voices

definitions: a highway that encircles a city or metropolitan area, designed to divert through traffic
examples: Traffic on the capital beltway was heavy during rush hour
They took the beltway to avoid downtown congestion

definitions: a small white whale found in Arctic waters, known for its distinctive rounded head
a large sturgeon fish prized for producing expensive beluga caviar
examples: The beluga whale pod swam gracefully through the icy Arctic waters
Marine biologists study beluga communication through their complex vocalizations
Beluga caviar is considered one of the world's most luxurious foods
The beluga sturgeon population has declined due to overfishing

definitions: a standard or point of reference against which things may be compared or assessed for quality or performance
examples: The company's sales figures set a new benchmark for the industry
They used last year's results as a benchmark for measuring improvement

definitions: an extended period of excessive drinking or drug use
a tool or machine used to bend pipes, metal, or other materials
examples: He went on a three-day bender after losing his job
The weekend bender left him feeling terrible on Monday
The plumber used a pipe bender to shape the copper tubing
This metal bender can handle sheets up to quarter-inch thickness

definitions: the action or process of making something curved or angular rather than straight
examples: The bending of light through water creates optical illusions
Repeated bending weakened the metal until it finally broke
